revised_title: Early Contributions to Solid State Physics: Lattice Dynamics and X-ray Diffraction
tldr: The author recounts their early work on lattice dynamics and X-ray diffraction, discussing their contributions to the understanding of thermal motion in crystals and the development of the dynamical matrix. They also describe their studies on the scattering of radiation by atoms and the impact of quantum mechanics on X-ray scattering. Their work laid the foundation for future research in solid state physics and crystallography.
